messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Paths to files containing the App\Http\Controllers\CommentController@destroy handler implementation:
- app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php

Explanation:
- The route in routes/auth.php uses App\Http\Controllers\CommentController (via CommentController::class) for the /comments/{comment} resource, so the destroy method implementation resides in the class defined in app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php.
- Inspecting that file shows the destroy method:
  - It authorizes the deletion with $this->authorize('delete', $comment).
  - Deletes the comment with $comment->delete().
  - Returns a Turbo Streams response that removes the comment element and updates the comments count.

Note:
- There are other CommentController classes in different namespaces (e.g., app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php and app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php), but they belong to different namespaces and are not the App\Http\Controllers\CommentController referenced by the route in routes/auth.php.

files.description: List of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations.
